intro: Pleiotaxis welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch pleiotaxis, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and Angola, and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
